meanings.definition: Supple and graceful in movement or shape.
meanings.sent1: The dancer's lithest movements captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the lithest gymnast in the competition.
meanings.sent3: The lithest cat in the neighborhood always managed to squeeze through the smallest gaps.
meanings.sent4: Her lithest performance on stage was like a flowing river of elegance.
meanings.sent5: The lithest branches of the willow tree swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Having a body characterized by ease and flexibility of movement.
meanings.sent1: The lithest yoga instructor effortlessly demonstrated each pose.
meanings.sent2: As a contortionist, he had the lithest body on the circus team.
meanings.sent3: The lithest acrobat in the troupe could bend in ways that seemed impossible.
meanings.sent4: Her lithest limbs moved with the fluidity of a dancer.
meanings.sent5: The lithest figure skater glided across the ice with grace and precision.

meanings.definition: Characterized by lightness and ease of movement.
meanings.sent1: The lithest fabric of the dress floated delicately in the wind.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah is one of the lithest animals in the wild.
meanings.sent3: The lithest feather drifted slowly to the ground.
meanings.sent4: His lithest steps on the dance floor seemed almost weightless.
meanings.sent5: The lithest clouds in the sky moved swiftly with the wind.
